unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Load Shedding Persists in Northern States**
normalised: **Energy and Utilities: Load Shedding Persists in Northern States**

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26th - Several northern states including Uttar Pradesh and Haryana are facing extended periods of load shedding, impacting households and businesses alike. The outages, reportedly lasting up to 6 hours in some rural areas, are attributed to a combination of increased demand due to the festive season and disruptions in coal supply to key power plants.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty sixth - Several northern states including Uttar Pradesh and Haryana are facing extended periods of load shedding, impacting households and businesses alike. The outages, reportedly lasting up to six hours in some rural areas, are attributed to a combination of increased demand due to the festive season and disruptions in coal supply to key power plants.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, Director of the Central Electricity Authority (CEA), stated that efforts are underway to normalize supply. However, he acknowledged that challenges remain in coordinating coal transport logistics.
normalised: Doctor Sharma, Director of the Central Electricity Authority (C E A), stated that efforts are underway to normalize supply. However, he acknowledged that challenges remain in coordinating coal transport logistics.

unnormalised: Small business owners in Kanpur have voiced concerns over lost productivity, estimating daily losses running into thousands of Rs. due to the power cuts. Farmers in Punjab are also struggling to irrigate their fields, impacting the upcoming Rabi crop.
normalised: Small business owners in Kanpur have voiced concerns over lost productivity, estimating daily losses running into thousands of rupees due to the power cuts. Farmers in Punjab are also struggling to irrigate their fields, impacting the upcoming Rabi crop.

unnormalised: The UP Power Corporation Ltd (UPPCL) has announced revised load shedding schedules, available on their website. The CEA is also investigating claims of infrastructure inadequacies hindering power distribution to newly developed residential areas, some spanning over 50,000 sq ft. Alternative energy solutions, including solar power, are being discussed as long-term measures to mitigate future disruptions.
normalised: The U P P C L has announced revised load shedding schedules, available on their website. The C E A is also investigating claims of infrastructure inadequacies hindering power distribution to newly developed residential areas, some spanning over fifty thousand square feet. Alternative energy solutions, including solar power, are being discussed as long-term measures to mitigate future disruptions.
